articles.headline: Colts' DeForest Buckner back from IR; Sauce Gardner out again
articles.description: The Colts are getting DT DeForest Buckner back from injured reserve but will be without CB Sauce Gardner again vs. the 49ers on Monday night.

articles.headline: Cowboys activate CB Trevon Diggs ahead of Chargers game
articles.description: The Cowboys activated Trevon Diggs off injured reserve on Saturday, giving the two-time Pro Bowl cornerback the opportunity to play Sunday against the Chargers.

images.name: Stephen A. declares Cowboys' season a failure
images.caption: Stephen A. Smith weighs in on the Cowboys' woes after their loss to the Vikings.

articles.headline: NFL Week 16 predictions, fantasy sleepers, QB notes, bets
articles.description: Fantasy upside for J.J. McCarthy and Tyler Shough? An advantage for the Bears' rushing attack? Upset brewing in Commanders-Eagles? Let's look at Week 16.
articles.byline: Matt Bowen, Pamela Maldonado, Eric Moody, Ben Solak, Seth Walder and NFL Nation

articles.headline: Lions understand it's win or go home the rest of the way
articles.description: Their playoff odds aren't the best, but the Lions say, "There's never a panic with us, we know what we need to do."

images.name: Matthew Stafford [608x342]
images.caption: The Lions surrendered 41 points in last week's loss the Los Angeles Rams.

images.name: Why Rich Eisen believes the Lions can still make the playoffs
images.caption: Rich Eisen believes the Lions can run the table and still make the playoffs despite losing to the Rams in Week 15.

articles.headline: What to make of Ashton Jeanty's rookie season
articles.description: How Raiders rookie Ashton Jeanty looked during the 2025 season, and what's next for the running back.

images.name: Ashton Jeanty running vs. Jags [608x342]
images.caption: "... He's done his job. We have to give him more opportunities and more space," coach Pete Carroll said of Ashton Jeanty.

images.name: Ashton Jeanty [608x342]
images.caption: Ashton Jeanty has rushed for 700 yards this season.

images.name: Raiders huddle [608x342]
images.caption: Against the Eagles last week, the Raiders' offense only totaled 75 yards.

images.name: Why Yates predicts Jeanty will score under 10 fantasy points
images.caption: Field Yates breaks down why he has Ashton Jeanty scoring under 10 fantasy points in Week 16.

articles.headline: How Bears DC Dennis Allen has created a takeaway machine
articles.description: The Bears lead the NFL in takeaways differential (plus-20), interceptions (21) and total takeaways (30). Here's why.

images.name: D'Marco Jackson #48 [1296x729]
images.caption: D'Marco Jackson (48) had been cut from the Saints and didn't know where he would land next. But Dennis Allen, who coached Jackson in New Orleans, knew he could help the Bears. Jackson was recently named NFC defensive player of the week.

images.name: Dennis Allen [1296x729]
images.caption: Allen has head coaching experience, and that helped him earn a level of trust among his players.

images.name: Pat McAfee: Are they still the Chicago Bears if they're in Indiana?
images.caption: Pat McAfee reacts to the Bears expanding their stadium search to the state of Indiana.

article.headline: Falcons ride Robinson's 170 rushing yards, including 81-yard TD, to 24-14 win over Allen and Bills
article.description: — Big plays from Bijan Robinson and Drake London and mistake-free leadership from Michael Penix Jr. made the Atlanta Falcons look like a playoff contender.
article.linkText: Falcons ride Robinson's 170 rushing yards, including 81-yard TD, to 24-14 win over Allen and Bills

images.name: Falcons take down Bills on MNF
images.caption: The Falcons jump out to an early lead and hang on for an upset victory over the Bills.

article.story: ATLANTA -- — Big plays from Bijan Robinson and Drake London and mistake-free leadership from Michael Penix Jr. made the Atlanta Falcons look like a playoff contender. A lack of big offense and more miscues from Josh Allen provided more reason to question the Buffalo Bills. Robinson matched a career high with 170 rushing yards and gave Atlanta an early two-touchdown lead with the NFL's longest run of the season, and the Falcons denied Allen's comeback attempt to beat the Bills 24-14 on Monday night. Robinson's career-long 81-yard touchdown run in the second quarter put Atlanta (3-2) ahead 21-7. “We've been waiting for that moment,” Falcons coach Raheem Morris said. Robinson got his 170 yards on 19 carries. He added six catches for 68 yards for a career-best 238 yards from scrimmage. Morris said Robinson “is the best player in football; I've said it multiple times.” For Robinson's big game to come against Allen, last season's MVP, was meaningful because he paid the same compliment to the Bills quarterback. “I think he's the best football player in the NFL,” Robinson said. “Shout out to our defense. They made him uncomfortable the whole day.” London had 10 catches for 158 yards and a touchdown. Penix threw for 250 yards, including a 9-yard TD to London, while completing 20 of 32 passes without an interception. Allen threw two touchdown passes, including a 16-yarder to Ray Davis to open the second half. Allen and the Bills (4-2) were stopped on fourth down near midfield late in the third quarter. They failed to take advantage of another opportunity when Greg Rousseau blocked Parker Romo's 37-yard field-goal attempt early in the fourth. “Blocking the kick I thought was big for us,” Bills coach Sean McDermott said. “Obviously, I thought we had some momentum coming out of that. ... So overall, opportunities, just not good enough and getting the result we want.” Allen and the Bills again failed to capitalize. The Falcons secured the win with a 14-play, 5-minute drive that included Penix's 23-yard pass to Robinson. Romo's 33-yard field goal extended the lead to 10 points, and the Bills were left with 1:47 on the clock and no timeouts. “They had a good plan,” Allen said of the Falcons. “Looks like they came off the bye week and got to game-plan us quite a bit. Again, I’ve got to be better in seeing the things they’re trying to do to us and make adjustments accordingly.” Atlanta linebacker DeAngelo Malone intercepted Allen's last throw with 41 seconds remaining. Allen completed 15 of 26 passes for 180 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions, giving him four interceptions in his last three games. He had only one pick in his previous 12 games, including the playoffs. Tyler Allgeier scored the Falcons' first touchdown on a 21-yard run. Allen had the support of a strong contingent of Buffalo fans who were so loud that Penix was forced to use a silent count on an early possession. From 4-0 to 4-2 The Bills' loss added more reasons to doubt their 4-0 start. Those wins came against teams that are now a combined 3-21: Baltimore (1-5), the New York Jets (0-6), Miami (1-5) and New Orleans (1-5). “We’ll work hard at it,” McDermott said. “We’ve got to figure it out. It’s not going to be easy, but we got to figure out it out and work our tails off to get it done.” No Ray-Ray McCloud In a surprise, Falcons wide receiver Ray-Ray McCloud III, normally a starter, was a healthy scratch and was on the sideline in street clothes. The move came despite another starter, Darnell Mooney (hamstring), getting ruled out on Saturday. Morris called the move “a coaches' decision” and said McCloud will “be back out competing next week.” Two weeks to clean up The Bills have a bye week. When asked if the timing was good, Allen said: “It’s going to eat at me for the next two weeks. I mean, a lot of stuff to clean up. We’ll put our focus on our next opponent and go from there.” Injuries Bills: WR Joshua Palmer (left ankle) was ruled out early in the second half. ... LB Terrel Bernard left with a right ankle injury. ... TE Dalton Kincaid was inactive with an oblique injury. The decision was made after he participated in pregame warmups. Kincaid leads the team 287 receiving yards and three touchdowns and had a career-best 108 yards in his last game. DT DaQuan Jones, a starter, was held out after suffering a calf injury in pregame warmups. Falcons: LT Jake Matthews (ankle) was escorted to the locker room late in the first half and ruled out. ... Starting nickel back Billy Bowman Jr. (knee, hamstring) was inactive. Up next Bills: After a bye, Buffalo plays another NFC South team when it visits Carolina on Oct. 26. Falcons: In another prime-time game, Atlanta visits San Francisco on Sunday night. ------ AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/nfl
